alert.note: Alert for Effingham (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 03 at 11:23PM CDT until further notice by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Illinois, including the following county, northern Effingham. * WHEN...Until 100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1121 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated another area of thunderstorms moving through western Effingham County, producing rainfall accumulations of a half to 1.5 inches. These storms are moving southeast and will impact Effingham before midnight. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Effingham, Altamont, Teutopolis, Watson, Beecher City, Shumway, Moccasin, Lake Sara, Altamont Reservoir, Effingham County Airport and Heartville.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
